summary: This email chain from February 2020 discusses legal disputes in the probate of Jeffrey Epstein's estate, primarily between the estate's executors and the Virgin Islands Attorney General. It covers the AG's intervention, liens freezing estate assets, demands for a victim compensation program, and allegations against Epstein's lawyers.

persons.name: Denise George
persons.role: Attorney General of the US Virgin Islands
persons.context: She is bringing charges against Epstein's estate, alleging fraud, and is in a dispute with the estate's executors over the victim compensation program and liens on estate assets.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.role: Lawyer and Executor of Epstein's estate
persons.context: Named as an executor in Epstein's will and alleged by the Virgin Islands AG to have been part of Epstein's alleged fraud.

persons.name: Richard Kahn
persons.role: Lawyer and Executor of Epstein's estate
persons.context: Named as an executor in Epstein's will and alleged by the Virgin Islands AG to have been part of Epstein's alleged fraud.

persons.name: Bennet Moskowitz
persons.context: Claimed that liens by the Virgin Islands AG have prevented the release of money from Epstein's fortune to a victim compensation fund.

persons.name: Ken Feinberg
persons.context: Reportedly asked to oversee a voluntary resolution program for Epstein's accusers, having previously overseen claims for 9/11, Catholic church abuse, and the BP oil spill.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Deceased financier and accused sex trafficker
persons.context: The subject of the probate case. His estate is valued at $570 million, and there are ongoing investigations into his associates and victim claims for compensation.

persons.name: Edward Helmore
persons.context: Author of The Guardian article referenced in the email about the dispute between Epstein's lawyers and the Virgin Islands.

connections.description: Both named as executors in Jeffrey Epstein's will, which was modified two days before his death to be executed in the Caribbean territory.
Indyke was Epstein's lawyer and was named as an executor of his estate.
Kahn was Epstein's lawyer and was named as an executor of his estate.
Moskowitz is representing Epstein's estate, of which Indyke is an executor.
Moskowitz is representing Epstein's estate, of which Kahn is an executor.
George, as Virgin Islands AG, has brought charges against Epstein's estate and alleged Indyke may have been part of Epstein's fraud.
George, as Virgin Islands AG, has brought charges against Epstein's estate and alleged Kahn may have been part of Epstein's fraud.
Feinberg was reportedly asked to oversee a victim compensation program for Epstein's accusers.

events.title: Probate Court Denies Virgin Islands AG Intervention
events.description: The probate court denied the Virgin Islands Attorney General's motion to intervene in the Epstein estate probate proceedings.

events.title: Estate Files for Emergency Relief
events.description: The executors of Epstein's estate moved the probate court for emergency relief to gain full access to the estate's frozen funds to pay administrative expenses without the Virgin Islands AG's prior approval.

events.title: Virgin Islands AG Brings Charges Against Estate
events.description: Virgin Islands Attorney General Denise George brought charges against Epstein's estate, alleging fraud related to a banking license and naming his lawyers as potential co-defendants.

events.title: Epstein Arrested on Federal Charges
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested on fresh federal sex trafficking and conspiracy charges.

events.title: Epstein's Death in Jail
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide in a Manhattan jail cell after pleading not guilty to the new federal charges.

events.title: Epstein's Florida Plea
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein pleaded guilty to a Florida state prostitution charge and served a 13-month jail sentence.

locations: Epstein's two islands (in the Virgin Islands)
keyFacts: The Virgin Islands Attorney General, Denise George, has placed liens on Jeffrey Epstein's estate, freezing its bank accounts and demanding approval over all expenditures.
George alleges that Epstein's lawyers and estate executors, Darren Indyke and Richard Kahn, may have been part of Epstein's alleged fraud and plans to name them as co-defendants.
Epstein's estate is valued at approximately $570 million, and a victim compensation program proposed to be overseen by Ken Feinberg is being contested by the Virgin Islands AG.
The Virgin Islands AG demands the estate waive non-disclosure agreements for former employees, provide a complete asset inventory, and exclude the executors from the victim compensation program.
Epstein modified his will two days before his death to have it executed in the Caribbean territory, naming Indyke and Kahn as executors.
